required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Faldaprevir of Soft Capsule
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Single and Multiple Oral Doses of 120 mg and 240 mg BI 201335 in Healthy Chinese Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the trial is to assess the bioavailability of Faldaprevir soft capsule with single oral dose and multiple oral doses in Chinese subjects

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Single dose:AUC,1 (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over a uniform dosing interval after administration of the first dose)
Single dose:AUC0- (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity)
Single dose:AUCtz- (the percentage of the AUC 0- that is obtained by extrapolation)
Single dose:z (terminal rate constant in plasma)
Single dose: t1/2 (terminal half-life of the analyte in plasma)
Single dose: tz (time of last measurable concentration of the analyte in plasma
Single dose: MRTpo (mean residence time of the analyte in the body after po administration)
Single dose:CL/F (apparent clearance of the analyte in plasma following po administration)
Single dose:Vz/F (apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase z following an po administration)
Multiple Dose:Cmin,ss (minimum concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state over a uniform dosing interval )
Multiple Dose:z,ss (terminal rate constant in plasma at steady state)
Multiple Dose: MRTpo,ss (mean residence time of the analyte in the body at steady state after po administration)
Multiple Dose:CL/F,ss (apparent clearance of the analyte in the plasma at steady state following po multiple dose administration)
Multiple Dose:Vz/F,ss (apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase z at steady state following po administration)
Multiple Dose:Cpre,N (predose concentration of the analyte in plasma immediately before administration of the Nth dose after N-1 doses were administered)
Multiple Dose: tmax(,N) (time from last dosing to maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma after administration of N doses)

Multiple Dose:In addition, the accumulation ratios (RA, Cmax, based on Cmax; RA, AUC, based on AUC0-) and the linearity index (LI) of the analyte in plasma following ten doses in healthy volunteers over a uniform dosing interval will be calculated.
Multiple Dose: Cmax,ss(maximum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state over a uniform dosing interval )
Multiple Dose: AUC,ss (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma at steady state over a uniform dosing interval )
Single dose: Cmax (maximum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma)
Single Dose:AUC0-tz (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the last quantifiable concentration at tz) (if applicable)
Multiple Dose:t1/2,ss (terminal half-life of the analyte in plasma at steady state) (if applicable)
Multiple Dose:tmax,ss (time from last dosing to maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state)

arm_group.description: 10 subjects (approximate sex ration: 1:1) will be assigned to trial by single and multiple dose.
10 subjects (approximate sex ration: 1:1) will be assigned to trial by single and multiple dose.

intervention.description: faldaprevir(high dose) will be taken by 1 day single use and 10 days multiple use. the subjects will be assigned to high dose treatment in random order
faldaprevir(low dose) will be taken by 1 day single use and 10 days multiple use. the subjects will be assigned to low dose treatment in random order

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Healthy male and female subjects
Exclusion criteria:
Any relevant deviation from healthy conditionsAny relevant deviation from healthy conditions
